column4: anyone want to tray and make ubuntu mount a hard drive?  just like this: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/302960
ubuntu 2.6.24-22-generic works fine but 2.6.27-11-generic will not mount the drive !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
please someone must know what is stopping the new ubuntu from mounting drives
I haven't had that problem myself. If it's just not detecting when devices are plugged in, make sure that the hal service is running
it's not that I don't think because of whats in the dmesg
dmesg is kernel logs; hal is what relays that information to userland.
anyhow, if you try to do the mount manually, does it work?
like in the bug report I can't mount because sdb does not exist let alone sdb1    !
ahh -- I think I missed something, then; did you paste a link to a bug report / your pastebinned dmesg output?
is this a Nokia phone you're mounting, or are you just getting the same message?
same problem but for just an ordinary drive in a usb external box
will you help as Jack_Sparrow bailed (nice guy but he has other things to do atm)
last time I had that error it was related to the USB device failing.
does it work in any other machine?
yes it works fine on the LTS
...odd. I'm not sure it's an issue I'm equipt to help you with, unfortunately. If it really does, right now, today work well with the LTS release, you might consider downgrading to that kernel.
